item.title: Install Ruby gems into virtualenv
item.description: You are a Python developer and every time you have to install a Ruby gem you throw up in your mouth a little. Wouldn’t it be nice if you could install Ruby gems into your virtualenv? Yeah, it would. Stick this in your virtualenv’s postactivate script: export GEM_HOME="$VIRTUAL_ENV/gems" export GEM_PATH="" export PATH=$PATH:"$GEM_HOME/bin" That’s it! You’re welcome. :) Credit Give credit where credit is due. I stole this idea from Idan Gazit and made it better.
